content:
There are several instances in the New Testament where counterfeit Christs are mentioned. Some examples include:

1. Matthew 24:23-25 (Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is Christ, or there; believe it not. For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; insomuch that, if it were possible, they shall deceive the very elect. Behold, I have told you before.)
2. Mark 13:21-22 (And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here is Christ; or, lo, he is there; believe him not: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect.)
3. 2 Corinthians 11:4 (For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.)
4. 2 Thessalonians 2:3 (Let no man deceive you by any means: for that day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition;)

These passages indicate that there will be many false Christs that will arise, and that they will come in many forms, and will try to deceive the people. They will be able to perform signs and wonders, but that should not deceive the elect, and people should be careful not to follow them.
